article.headline: Jackson St. 77, Tougaloo 74
article.story: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) -- Trey Johnson and Julius Young scored 19 points apiece to lead Jackson State to a 77-74 win over Tougaloo on Monday. Jackson State (5-6) was playing its first home game of the season and overcame a sluggish first half in which the team shot only 29 percent but somehow managed a 27-21 halftime lead. Young and Johnson scored 11 of Jackson State's first 17 points of the second half to stretch the lead to 44-30 with 11:36 to play. Jackson State led by as much as 59-43, but Tougaloo (1-5), led by Kevin McCoy's 40 points, pulled to within 76-74 with 16 seconds remaining. Johnson, who entered the game averaging nearly 30 points a game, hit one of two free throws with 4.3 seconds left for a 77-74 lead. McCoy tried to send the game into overtime, but his 3-point attempt bounced off the rim as time expired. Jeremy Caldwell added 11 points for Jackson State.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
